pull_request_title: t3c RPM DB check to work with rocky linux 9
pull_request_body:
<!--
Thank you for contributing! Please be sure to read our contribution guidelines: https://github.com/apache/trafficcontrol/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
If this closes or relates to an existing issue, please reference it using one of the following:

Closes: #ISSUE
Related: #ISSUE

If this PR fixes a security vulnerability, DO NOT submit! Instead, contact
the Apache Traffic Control Security Team at security@trafficcontrol.apache.org and follow the
guidelines at https://apache.org/security regarding vulnerability disclosure.
-->
Closes: #7860
Rocky Linux 9 has changed the database format for the RPM database. This causes the RPM DB check to fail and t3c will not run in badass mode. 

t3c has been updated to detect RPM database type and use the proper check for the database detected. If the RPM database type can not be determined the check will be skipped. Note that sqlite type database will only be checked if sqlite is installed on the cache. If it is not installed the check will be skipped. 
  
<!-- **^ Add meaningful description above** --><hr/>

## Which Traffic Control components are affected by this PR?
<!-- Please delete all components from this list that are NOT affected by this PR.
Feel free to add the name of a tool or script that is affected but not on the list.
-->

- Traffic Control Cache Config (`t3c`, formerly ORT)


## What is the best way to verify this PR?
<!-- Please include here ALL the steps necessary to test your PR.
If your PR has tests (and most should), provide the steps needed to run the tests.
If not, please provide step-by-step instructions to test the PR manually and explain why your PR does not need tests. -->
run t3c in syncds or badass mode on a cache with Rocky Linux 9, verify expected behavior in the logs.

## If this is a bugfix, which Traffic Control versions contained the bug?
<!-- Delete this section if the PR is not a bugfix, or if the bug is only in the master branch.
Examples:
- 5.1.2
- 5.1.3 (RC1)
 -->
7.0.x
8.0.x

pull_request_conversation: [{'comment_body': "if sqlite is not installed, it will, log that it needs sqlite3 to do the db check, then skip the check if it's not available. "}]
